7176F140B21845A5850CC97788C2E829.description: Skills/Processes: Social Participation as a Democratic Practice

932EBF531E264EAC861214FFBCA6FC6C.description: Uses technology to apply the research process (e.g. designs and follows a plan, making revisions as necessary, accesses and retrieves information from the Internet using a specific search path or given URLs, organizes information using databases, spreadsheets or electronic webbing, uses a variety of technologies to organize and synthesize researched information, reflects on and describes the processes involved in completing a project)

27A09512F9EF4A71A42EC5EB0D329C73.description: Applies the research process (e.g. determines reliability of information filtering for point of view and bias, formulates questions, uses graphs, tables, charts and Venn diagrams to interpret information, draws and supports conclusions based on information gathered, includes references, formulates new questions as research progresses)

4F524985988044689D7D3FA9AE46DAB3.description: Uses technology to demonstrate skills of decision making and problem solving (e.g. selects and uses technology to assist in problem solving, uses data gathered from electronic sources to address problems, solves problems using calculators, spreadsheets, databases or hypertext technology, uses graphic organizers to present connections between ideas and information, solves issue-related problems,using communication tools such as a word processor or e-mail, generates alternative solutions to problems)

7F62EEAFD7A042F0A9778994C679740F.description: Demonstrates skills of historical thinking (e.g. interprets historical events, understands and organizes the sequence of historical events, explains the context of key events of a given time period, uses examples to describe cause and effect and change over time, organizes information using electronic tools)

2A1FCCC1D31247DBA57D3C91211DCABB.description: Demonstrates skills of geographic thinking (e.g. constructs and interprets various types of maps, uses geographic tools that assist in preparing graphs and maps, uses cardinal and intermediate directions; uses scale to determine distance, identifies geographic problems and issues and poses geographic questions)

7378DC5FC90344CFA86B821A72F0E9D8.description: Demonstrates skills of decision making and problem solving (e.g. proposes and applies new ideas, strategies and options, considers multiple perspectives, collaborates with others)

5D5BEF6097C14235A79343BCD100B07F.description: Demonstrates skills of critical and creative thinking (e.g. identifies bias, distinguishes fact from opinion, evaluates ideas, re-evaluates opinions, generates original ideas and strategies, seeks responses to inquiries through electronic media)

FB26BF78AF2D462AB027718A27469301.description: Uses technology to demonstrate skills of oral, written and visual literacy (e.g. organizes information gathered from the Internet, or an electronic source, selecting and recording the data in logical files, communicates effectively through appropriate forms, such as speeches, reports and multimedia presentation, applying information technologies that serve particular audiences and purposes)

EDE20AE8AABC4C35B1B74C8BC08100D8.description: Uses technology to demonstrate skills of media literacy (e.g. identifies and distinguishes points of view expressed in electronic sources, uses presentation tools to demonstrate connections among various pieces of information, recognizes that information serves different purposes and that data from electronic sources may need to be verified to determine accuracy or relevance for the purpose used)

22F74DC9B03642CF9BC58DB0FC1DC334.description: Demonstrates skills of oral, written and visual literacy (e.g. expresses opinions and information in a variety of forms such as oral or written presentation, speeches or debates, expresses reasons for ideas and opinions, uses skill of informal debate to persuasively express differing viewpoints, responds appropriately to comments and questions using language respectful of human diversity, listens to others in order to understand their perspectives)

0C79E301775B46EF83600A917D3C9D38.description: Demonstrates skills of media literacy (e.g. detects bias in the media, examines and assesses diverse perspectives regarding an issue presented in the media, analyzes current affairs)
